title: MEAS MECH_ENG 395-0-20 Special Topics in Mechanical Engineering

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Fundamentals of the science of energy production and utilization and their impact on the environment.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: A first course in Thermodynamics and/or Fluids is recommended. This course is for graduate students or advanced undergraduates primarily in mechanical, chemical, or civil and environmental engineering or materials science.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Complete processes for production and utilization of renewable and fossil energy sources. Life cycle impacts of processes and design of energy production systems considering available feedstocks, desired fuels, and impact on greenhouse gas emissions. Fundamentals of the mathematical theory of combustion processes.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: Reference books and material to be posted online
